channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bolsonaro To Start Serving 27-Year Prison Sentence Over Coup Plot
item.description: Brazil’s Supreme Court ordered former President Jair Bolsonaro to begin serving a prison term for conspiring to remain in power after losing the last ...

item.title: The ‘New’ Solution for the N.Y.C. Housing Crisis: Single-Room Apartments
item.description: There is a push to revive single-room occupancy housing, where kitchens and bathrooms are shared among apartments as small as 100 square feet each.

item.title: Doctor Critical of Vaccines Quietly Appointed as C.D.C.’s Second in Command
item.description: During the Covid-19 pandemic, Dr. Ralph Lee Abraham promoted discredited treatments like ivermectin and, as Louisiana’s surgeon general, halted the st...

item.title: Joan Branson, Richard Branson’s Wife of 35 Years, Dies at 80
item.description: Mr. Branson, the Virgin Atlantic founder, announced her death in an Instagram post.

item.title: ‘Dr. Doom’ Nouriel Roubini breaks with the crowd on the AI bubble, saying the U.S. is headed for a ‘growth recession’ and not a market crash
item.description: “The now common view,” according to the NYU Stern School of Business professor emeritus, “is incorrect over the medium term.”

item.title: Elon Musk might have just accidentally revealed that a lot of MAGA influencers are based in South Asia, Africa and Eastern Europe
item.description: Elon Musk’s X unveiled a feature Saturday that lets users see where an account is based. Oops.

item.title: ‘Just enough to spend, not enough to splurge’: The low-hire labor market bites for Gen Z and lower-income Americans, JPMorgan finds
item.description: Workers ages 50–54 are experiencing negative real income growth, year over year, so reality bites for Gen Xers in the 2025 economy, too.

item.title: Outside the U.S. and Europe, the momentum of China’s open source AI models is plain to see
item.description: Control over costs and data trump pure performance for businesses in many parts of the world.

item.title: Meet Ralph Lee Abraham, the CDC’s new second-in-command who believes the Affordable Care Act should be repealed and called vaccines ‘dangerous’
item.description: Abraham, 70, started his career in veterinary medicine.

item.title: Vahid Abedini, University of Oklahoma Professor, Released After ICE Detainment
item.description: Vahid Abedini, who colleagues said was in the United States on an H-1B visa, was arrested on his way to a conference in Washington. It was unclear why...

item.title: BBC Accused of Censoring Trump by Dutch Historian Rutger Bregman
item.description: Rutger Bregman said his comment that President Trump was the “most openly corrupt president in American history” was removed before his lecture was br...
